title: Sales Performance and Client Segmentation of RevoBank

sections.title: Porject Overview
sections.content: RevoBank is a European financial institution that offers premium banking services and credit products tailored to modern consumers. Their strategic goal for this project was to drive higher utilization of credit cards by understanding customer behavior and improving engagement. However, they faced a challenge: identifying inactive clients and uncovering behavioral patterns that were limiting product usage and overall sales potential.

content.title: Business Understanding
content.description: Aligned with stakeholder goals to define key business questions around customer inactivity, sales trends, and promotional effectiveness.

content.title: Data Preparation & Cleaning
content.description: Processed raw datasets using pandas, ensuring consistency in data types, formatting, and completeness to support reliable analysis.

content.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)
content.description: Analyzed transaction patterns, demographic distribution, and promotional exposure using descriptive stats, grouping, and visualization tools like Matplotlib and seaborn.

content.title: Metric Calculation
content.description: Engineered metrics including Total Sales, Average Profit per Segment, Promotion Effectiveness Rate, and Inactivity Rate to quantify business impact.

content.title: Customer Segmentation
content.description: Segmented clients by generation, gender, and activity level using rule-based logic and their spending power using RFM method.

content.title: Data Visualization
content.description: Build clean and fresh chart using Matplotlib and Seaborn.

content.title: Insight & Recommendation
content.description: Synthesized trends into strategic recommendations, leveraging EDA insights and metric benchmarks to propose campaign optimizations.

content.title: Strong Revenue, Missed Potential
content.description: RevoBank achieved €402.6M in total sales over 3 years, yet 6.07% of clients were completely inactive, pointing to revenue gaps that targeted campaigns could bridge.

content.title: Customer Engagement Risk
content.description: Around 23.3% of clients are at risk of churn due to low transaction frequency and sales contribution. This highlighting urgency for reactivation and nurturing strategies.

content.title: Generational Behavior
content.description: Gen X and Millennials prefer fewer but high-value transactions, making them ideal targets for discount-driven campaigns. Gen Z’s market is still unstable, while Boomers are oversaturated.
content.alt: Average sales and transaction each generation

content.title: Promotion Fatigue Threshold
content.description: Promotional effectiveness declines sharply after 8 rounds; Boomer and Millennial segments show resistance to repeated outreach, necessitating smarter cadence control.
content.alt: Graph of times direct promotion done and their sales success

content.title: Gender Profitability Dynamics
content.description: Female customers dominate all segments and drive higher total profit, although males show higher average profit per user. This suggest a need for gender-aware strategies.

content.title: Segment Revenue Concentration
content.description: Despite their small numbers, Premium Clients and Royal but not Loyal contribute over 40% of total revenue, making them high-priority targets for retention and VIP incentives.
content.alt: Pie chart showing segmentation with RFM

content.title: Target Inactive Clients
content.description: Launch reactivation campaigns for the 6.07% of inactive users using personalized promotions and limited-time offers.

content.title: Prioritize Gen X & Millennials
content.description: Focus marketing efforts on segments with high-value, infrequent transactions by offering discounts tailored to their behavior.

content.title: Cap Promotion Frequency
content.description: Limit direct promotional outreach to no more than 7–8 times to prevent engagement drop-off due to promotion fatigue.

content.title: Use RFM-Based Strategies
content.description: Apply tailored actions to key segments, such as onboarding for One-Timers, loyalty rewards for Premium Clients, and revival efforts for Loss Clients.

content.title: Maximize Segment Revenue Efficiency
content.description: Prioritize Premium and Royal-but-not-Loyal customers who generate over 40% of total revenue despite their small population.

content.title: Develop Gender-Aware Campaigns
content.description: Leverage the stronger profit performance among female customers while optimizing for higher average profit per male user.

content.title: Offer Membership Incentives
content.description: Introduce tiered membership or VIP perks to sustain high-value client engagement and reduce churn risk.
